content:
I am unsure of your issue. Are you wanting to switch to Thunderbird? Are you getting error messages? If you're wanting to switch to thunderbird, the simplest approach (in my opinion) would be this:

  1. exit betterbird
  2. make a backup copy of the appdata\roaming\betterbird folder
  3. then rename the betterbird folder to thunderbird
  4. then install thunderbird from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/
creator: davidsk

content:
OK, I found it. There is a 4th (!) setting concerning emptying the trash:

Account Settings > Local > Account Settings > Message Storage > Empty Trash on Exit

For some reason you can specify emptying the Trash on exit in 4 different ways, and if you specify it once it overrides the other 3...

content:
If the local folders location will be the same after reinstall, then you just need to copy the profile as it is. That is, if the profile is now pointing to drive D, the after reinstall, it will still point to the correct place.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: Wordt het bericht door Thunderbird als Ongewenst gemarkeerd (zichtbaar door een ‘vlampictogram’) of door uw e-mailprovider? In het laatste geval wijzigt het aanleren van Thunderbird dan namelijk niets, aangezien het bericht dan rechtstreeks in deze map binnenkomt en niet door Thunderbird wordt gescreend. Als de markering als spam al bij uw provider plaatsvindt, probeer dan de instelling voor dit bericht via uw webmail aan te passen.
creator: markh2

content:
In this section of the forum we speak Italian. For english support -> https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/thunderbird/form

I due eventi non sono probabilmente collegati. Da tempo infatti Gmail sta attivando procedure più gravose per chi vuole accedere tramite client. Le trovi riassunte qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-gmail

I menu sono nascosti per impostazione predefinita da molti anni. Basta premere Alt sulla tastiera per visualizzarli.

Più in generale Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
